entry.et: Middle English, to pay heed to, observe, notify, from Anglo-French advertiss-, stem of advertir

def.dt: :to make publicly and generally known advertising their readiness to make concessions
:to announce publicly especially by a printed notice or a broadcast
:to call public attention to especially by emphasizing desirable qualities so as to arouse a desire to buy or patronize :promote
:to issue or sponsor advertising advertise for a secretary
